author: Special Correspondent
text:
Students pursuing textiles and apparel design course in different colleges underwent training on draping and pattern manipulations from simple to complex styles at a workshop on ‘creative pattern making and draping’ held at the Periyar University here recently.

The workshop was organised by the Department of Textiles and Apparel Design of Periyar University.

It was an eye-opening experience for the young aspirants in the field of design.

The exercises like draping the fabric directly on the dress form and pattern interpretations were demonstrated by G.S. Dhapodkar, Senior Professor, School of Fashion, Styling and Textiles, Pearl academy, New Delhi.

He distinguished the role of fashion designers and technical designers. Once a fashion designer sketches a garment or accessories, the technical designer will figure out how a sketch can be brought to life.

Prof. Dhapodkar added that the technical designers who have skill in pattern making and draping are essentially the engineers of fashion.

C. Swaminathan, Vice-Chancellor, Periyar University, inaugurated the workshop.
title: Workshop held for students
